item.title: Freeman Mind "Mystery Episode"
item.dc:creator: jdshald
item.description:
Ross Scott: “It’s been proposed before that I switch over to the Black Mesa mod after this episode, but since that’s not out yet, I’ll just continue with regular half-life. You can expect something a little different for the next video as a kind of intermission after this one.”

“You can expect something a little different for the next video as a kind of intermission after this one.”

“You can expect something a little different for the next video.”

“You can expect something a little different”

“the next video”

OMFG (crosses fingers)

Read full topic

item.title: Freeman Mind "Mystery Episode"
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Spamds:

What’s the hype about freeman’s mind episodes? I watched few episodes and didn’t really find but few funny moments… and rest of it is just boring blabbering in epically long proportions. Not to mention that these episodes are so short that you’ll waste your time ratherly than find any comedic value in his repetitive sentences (Why iz evryone trying to kill me?) heard in basically every episode before…

Because they’re intended to be comical, but they’re also extremely logical. The thing is, it’s the most believable Gordon Freeman I’ve ever heard. It’s a genius totally flipping his shit from a combination of loneliness and a constant hostile environment. It’s just cool to watch.

Read full topic

item.description:
That’s what we all hope for.

Read full topic

item.title: Freeman Mind "Mystery Episode"
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Killer Monkey: I like the idea that Ross Scott played with. After being knocked out and dragged to the trash compactor, Gordon wakes up completely confused at the new graphics.

Spamds: You might not find them funny and you might find them boring, but others don’t. I, for one, think they’re fucking hilarious. Gordon is supposed to be this scientist that becomes this hero, and the way Ross Scott plays it off as a cocky egotist with delusions of grandeur, a problem with drugs and alcohol, and a bit looney tunes…is something completely off-kilter from the way most people understand Gordon Freeman. Every episode, to me, has great lines (“I am Gordon Freeman, President of the Intergalactic House of Pancakes”, “This looks like a job for Ambassador Pineapple”, and most recently, “I am the Bruce Lee of physics.”) and complete surprises (“I’d like to see a fish do this!”).

I just think it’s awesome…and hope that BM is finished and released by the time Gordon gets to the trash compactor.

Read full topic
